skill.name: devflow
skill.description: End-to-end agent development process. Use when coordinating work, dispatching agents, or reviewing PRs.
skill.summary: End-to-end agent development process. Use when coordinating work, dispatching agents, or reviewing P...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing development workflow guidelines. No executable code, network calls, or file system access detected. The skill defines a 5-phase development process for coordinating AI agents.

content.value_statement: Development teams struggle with coordinating AI agents and ensuring complete issue coverage. This skill provides a systematic 5-phase workflow that guarantees 100% requirement implementation through mandatory coverage verification at every step.
actual_capabilities: Defines 5-phase development workflow from assessment to merge
Coordinates parallel agent implementation with Docker
Implements 6-pass code review including coverage check
Integrates with GitHub CLI for issue and PR management
Requires Mermaid diagrams for complex architectural changes
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI for full functionality
Assumes Docker environment for agent dispatch
May be overly rigid for small changes

use_cases.title: Coordinate Multi-Agent Projects
use_cases.description: Manage complex development tasks by dispatching multiple AI agents in parallel while ensuring complete requirement coverage

use_cases.title: Systematic PR Review Process
use_cases.description: Follow a structured 6-pass review process that starts with verifying 100% issue coverage before checking code quality

use_cases.title: Ensure Complete Feature Delivery
use_cases.description: Track development progress with mandatory coverage gates that prevent merging until all requirements are implemented

prompt_templates.title: Start Development Workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Begin coordinated development on a new issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Use devflow to assess issue #123 and coordinate multi-agent development for implementing the user authentication feature

prompt_templates.title: Review PR with Coverage
prompt_templates.scenario: Review pull request with requirement verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply devflow Phase 3 review to PR #456, starting with 100% issue coverage verification before code quality checks

prompt_templates.title: Final Coverage Gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run devflow Phase 4.5 final coverage gate on PR #789 to ensure all requirements from issue #321 are implemented

prompt_templates.title: Complex Architecture Change
prompt_templates.prompt: Follow devflow for implementing the new microservices architecture and include Mermaid sequence diagrams in the PR

output_examples.input: Use devflow to coordinate implementing a new payment processing feature across multiple agents
output: Phase 1: Extracted 8 requirements from issue #234 including PCI compliance, webhook handling, and error recovery
Phase 2: Dispatched 3 agents - one for payment gateway integration, one for webhook processing, one for error handling
Phase 3: Completed 6-pass review with 100% coverage verification
Phase 4.5: Final coverage gate passed - all 8 requirements implemented across payment/gateway.rs:45-89, webhooks/handler.rs:23-67, errors/recovery.rs:12-34
Phase 5: Merged PR #567 with proper issue linking - issue #234 auto-closed

best_practices: Always start with Phase 1 Oracle Assessment to extract ALL requirements before implementation
Use the 6-pass review process, never skip the mandatory coverage verification (pass 0.5)
Include Mermaid diagrams in PRs when implementing flows, states, or architectural changes
anti_patterns: Never merge PRs without 100% issue coverage verification
Do not push directly to branches - always use feature branches with PRs
Avoid manual issue closing - use 'Closes #X' in PR body for automatic closure

faq.question: Is devflow compatible with non-GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: Devflow is optimized for GitHub with CLI integration but can be adapted for other Git platforms with modified commands

faq.question: What happens if coverage verification fails?
faq.answer: The workflow returns to Phase 2 with a detailed list of missing requirements - no merging is allowed below 100% coverage

faq.question: How does devflow integrate with existing CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Devflow works alongside CI/CD - Phase 3 review begins after CI passes but adds mandatory coverage verification before merge

faq.question: Is the 100% coverage requirement too strict for agile development?
faq.answer: The requirement ensures complete delivery - issues can be split into smaller tasks if needed to maintain agility while ensuring quality

faq.question: Can I use devflow for solo development?
faq.answer: Yes, but it's optimized for multi-agent coordination - solo developers can skip agent dispatch and use it as a structured review checklist

faq.question: How does the Docker agent dispatch work?
faq.answer: Phase 2 uses Docker containers to run independent Claude agents in parallel, each working on assigned task subsets from the breakdown
